name: Investment Regulations
description:
This law establishes regulations for the investment side of the Federal Bank. The Minister of Finance has oversight and authority over the Federal Bank Matters.

To Implement:
1) Create the following bank accounts: Outstanding Shares, Share Holding Account, Business Valuation Account, Share Price, Investment Charge, Investment Payout, Insurance Fund.
2) This law uses the currency exchange. One currency exchange handles the investment market and will need to be updated with personal currencies pointed at the "Outstanding Shares" account.
5) Various attributes of this law can be adjusted and should be reviewed by Parliament prior to passing. These include (a) frequency of market adjustments [found in article 3] and (b) market volatility controls [found in article 11], Share Dilution [Found in Article 14]

Credits: Author: Valfreya, based on idea by SirDoder, Testers: Nuura, Weylin, PandaDono

properties.Title: Setting Federal Bank Account Protections
properties.UserDescription: This article prevents transfers from citizens to any of the functional tracking accounts used by this law.

properties.Title: Selling Shares
properties.UserDescription: This article records selling shares. Selling shares only pays out (and charges the business) 90% of the share price.

properties.Title: Withdrawing Shares from the Market
properties.UserDescription:
If a citizen wishes to withdraw from the Stock Exchange, they notify the Minister of Finance (please also notify in chat or in discord). From there the Minister of Finance will:
1) Delist the personal currency from the exchange
2) Checks the currency report for the shares in circulation.
3) Collects amount from departing business, if possible.
4) Pays out shareholders from the insurance fund.
5) Empties the Outstanding Shares and Share Holding Accounts.
6) Puts a notice in the newspaper or notice board.

NOTE: Withdrawing from the financial market is FINAL, once you withdraw you cannot re-enter the market for the rest of the cycle.

User.contextDescription: The citizen who performed the interaction.

properties.Title: Market Preservation
properties.UserDescription:
This article preserves the market by prohibiting the direct transfer of supplemental financial instruments (currencies). It is not permitted trade Savings Notes, High Yield Savings Notes, Bonds (any type), Loan Notes, or Personal Currencies (in this case used as shares).

This article also establishes the maximum amount of shares that can be issued. This is capped to provide reasonable amount of shares and to prevent share dilution.

properties.Title: Bank Insurance Fund
properties.UserDescription: This article establishes the Insurance Fund that helps payout withdrawn businesses from the stock exchange when that business cannot pay out the shares. Any business participating in the stock/share exchange is liable for any amount due to the shareholders at time of withdrawl.

properties.Title: Minister of Finance Manual Withdraw or abandonment withdraw
properties.UserDescription: This article gives the authority to the Minister of Finance to remove a company from the exchange and when a player goes abandoned, this law forces them out of the stock exchange (via withdraw). An abandoned business is subject to seizure of monies or assets to cover liabilities to the shareholders.

properties.Title: Share Dilution Limit
properties.UserDescription:
This article establishes a share dilution limit. Share dilution occurs when the business issues additional shares (up to the maximum).

Parliamentry Values:
Cooldown between share dilution: 24 hours
Threshold: 10% of current total shares issued

properties.Formula: C - (SP + SH + BVA + IC + IP + BSR + G)
